channel.title: The system cannot find the path specified
channel.description:
HI, i try compiling a my client when i edited this comes up "he system cannot find the path specified" could anyone help me plz ? :)
[IMG]http://i368.photobucket.com/albums/oo128/codexselliot/omfg.jpg[/img]
anyone knw wat do ? =/

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @Gl_Then_Gf Gl Then Gf
item.description:
@Gl_Then_Gf wrote:

you can get codes from the internet. without putting an jdk in or jre. dont be lazy.

Read full topic
item.source: The system cannot find the path specified

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @xchr0nicx xchr0nicx
item.description:
@xchr0nicx wrote:

[quote=“imhot123, post:11, topic:356003”]if your runing windows 7 just paste this in your compiler

@echo off
title Simple Compiler
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

remember to switch the “jdk1.6.0_17” do the jdk version u got[/quote]

That is what I said o_O

Read full topic

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @imhot123 imhot123
item.description:
@imhot123 wrote:

if your runing windows 7 just paste this in your compiler

@echo off
title Simple Compiler
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

remember to switch the “jdk1.6.0_17” do the jdk version u got

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @whitenike whitenike
item.description:
@whitenike wrote:

Mwf2:

If your using a 317 then try to download another client that IS 317, cause they all have the same compile script. So just right click it and click EDIT, then copy and paste it into your 317 compile script.

i still cant do it fucked up now =/ i cba even try anymore to confusing thnxs for ur help though guys (Y)

Read full topic

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @whitenike whitenike
item.description:
@whitenike wrote:

[quote=“xchr0nicx, post:6, topic:356003”]Try this, but make SURE you have the correct directory… go to ur C program files - Java and see if it is jdk1.6.0_21 or what not, change it so see fit.

@echo off title Simple Compiler "C:\Programas\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause [/quote] i still cant do it =/ i wish i could :S any video tutorial u could make ? or something ? =/

Read full topic
item.source: The system cannot find the path specified

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @xchr0nicx xchr0nicx
item.description:
@xchr0nicx wrote:

Try this, but make SURE you have the correct directory… go to ur C program files - Java and see if it is jdk1.6.0_21 or what not, change it so see fit.

@echo off
title Simple Compiler
"C:\Programas\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
pause

Read full topic
item.source: The system cannot find the path specified

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @whitenike whitenike
item.description:
@whitenike wrote:

[quote=“xchr0nicx, post:4, topic:356003”]Here is the link - http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk6-jsp-136632.html

That is the latest one. Download it, install it.

Now edit the compiler too…

@echo off title Simple Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Make sure the directory points to where you installed JDK.[/quote] stil hasnt worked =/ but thnxs anyways anything else i can do ? =/

Read full topic
item.source: The system cannot find the path specified

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @xchr0nicx xchr0nicx
item.description:
@xchr0nicx wrote:

Here is the link - http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk6-jsp-136632.html

That is the latest one. Download it, install it.

Now edit the compiler too…

@echo off title Simple Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Make sure the directory points to where you installed JDK.

Read full topic
item.source: The system cannot find the path specified

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @whitenike whitenike
item.description:
@whitenike wrote:

[quote=“xchr0nicx, post:2, topic:356003”]Right click the file that you double clicked to open this, and click edit.

You will see something come up, make sure the path is correct. It should be to wherever your Java is installed, and make sure it is the correct version.

It should be something like…

@echo off title Simple Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/quote]
wich java shud i download :S =/

@ECHO OFF
color 77
title Pineapple X1
echo Pineapple X1 is here!
JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI
thats what rhe thing u told me to edit =/

Read full topic

item.title: The system cannot find the path specified
item.dc:creator: @xchr0nicx xchr0nicx
item.description:
@xchr0nicx wrote:

Right click the file that you double clicked to open this, and click edit.

You will see something come up, make sure the path is correct. It should be to wherever your Java is installed, and make sure it is the correct version.

It should be something like…

@echo off title Simple Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
